title: IBM Cloud overview docs
introduction: The platform is built to support your needs whether it's working only in the public cloud or taking advantage of a multicloud deployment model. Leverage the docs, API & SDK reference, architecture references, and more to support your app development needs.

section_recommended.title: What's included in the platform?
section_recommended.description: The platform consists of a network of interrelated components that work together to provide a consistent and dependable cloud experience to support your app development needs.

section_recommended.title: Try out IBM Cloud, for free
section_recommended.description: Get up and running quickly by setting up a Lite account with this short tutorial.

section_recommended.title: Service and infrastructure by location
section_recommended.description: Check out the regions and data centers that IBM Cloud products are available.

section_videos.title: Learn how to navigate through the IBM Cloud console

tiles.title: Scoping support cases to what matters to you
tiles.description: When you create a case in the IBM Cloud Support Center, you now have options to narrow the subject of your case to a specific topic that's most closely related to the issue you're experiencing. As a result, you can ensure that your support case gets routed to the appropriate support engineer and resolved as efficiently as possible.

tiles.title: Delivering notifications by using Slack Webhooks
tiles.description: In addition to generic webhooks, you can now add Slack webhooks to your distribution list and receive account-wide IBM Cloud notifications through them. To create a webhook, you need to set up an app in Slack and a unique URL. With this new webhook integration, you can easily receive the notifications in a selected Slack channel in which you installed your app.

tiles.title: Service-level discounts for accounts with the Pay as you go with Committed Use billing model
tiles.description: If you have an account with the Pay as you go with Committed Use billing model, you might be eligible to receive service-level discounts. You can apply service-level discounts to commitments in addition to the platform-level discount. Service-level discounts are provided by IBM Cloud Sales to customers with the Pay as you go with Committed Use billing model.
